title: Season 1: Machine-Learned Interatomic Potentials
lead: We explore machine learned potentials, starting from Parinello's classic architecture and working our way up to modern foundation models!
listDescription: Talks, resources, and papers from season 1

presentations.title: Generalized Neural-Network Representation of High-Dimensional Potential-Energy Surfaces
presentations.summary: We walk thorugh Behler Parinello's seminal work on MLIPs, discussing the changes in architecture and historical context that made this work so impactful!

paper.title: Generalized Neural-Network Representation of High-Dimensional Potential-Energy Surfaces

presentations.title: Deep Potential Molecular Dynamics: A Scalable Model with the Accuracy of Quantum Mechanics
presentations.summary: Introduction to DeepMD and its applications to large-scale molecular dynamics simulations with quantum accuracy.

paper.title: Deep Potential Molecular Dynamics: A Scalable Model with the Accuracy of Quantum Mechanics

presentations.title: E(3)-equivariant graph neural networks for data-efficient and accurate interatomic potentials
presentations.summary: Geometric ML applied to machine learned potentials.

paper.title: E(3)-equivariant graph neural networks for data-efficient and accurate interatomic potentials

presentations.title: UMA: A Family of Universal Models for Atoms
presentations.summary: UMA foundation model, and general discussions on foundation models for interatomic potentials.

paper.title: UMA: A Family of Universal Models for Atoms

presentations.title: Graph neural networks for materials science and chemistry
presentations.summary: Continued discussion of geometric ML in interatomic potentials.

paper.title: Bayesian error bars for ML potentials

presentations.title: Navigating protein landscapes with a machine-learned transferable coarse-grained model
presentations.summary: Navigating protein landscapes with a machine-learned transferable coarse-grained model.

paper.title: Navigating protein landscapes with a machine-learned transferable coarse-grained model
